text: Describe how the properties of rational numbers and the conventions of Order of Operations help you write and evaluate an expression?

Possible student answers might include:

Properties of rational numbers show how the numbers in expressions are related. We can use the properties to write (or find) equivalent expressions.

The Order of Operations helps us to find equivalent expressions. We know the order to do the operations.

Depending on the situation, the properties and/or the Order of Operations can help us find the values that we need.
